intro: Telephium exiguum, commonly known as the dwarf pussytoes, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, woodland habitats and is often found in shaded areas with rich, well-drained soil. Its foliage is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits. Telephium exiguum plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its native range.
